cards.title: Browse items are not sorted in Linux
EDGE and Chrome
cards.description:
- [x] Make sure that it works in Chrome
- [ ] Make sure that it works in EDGE
- [x] Make sure that it looks good in Chrome
- [x] Make sure that it looks good in EDGE

cards.title: Edge always drags the whole list
cards.description:
The ondrag event is called on the list even if you try to drag the card. Nothing I can do...

I would have to allow dragging lists by dragging only the header. Changes to the structure of the lists... Not today sorry...

The new EDGE, with Webkit as rendering engine should fix that!

cards.title: Freezing and socket errors on the server in Edge and Chrome
cards.description:
They say it's the WSGI reference server that leaves the port open for KeepAlive connections...

Out of my control :-/

cards.title: 304 Not Modified
cards.description:
**UPDATE**
Well look at that! Switching my main computer to Linux did the trick! LOL


**UPDATE**
Still not working, even after the switch to BottlePy, who claims it takes care of it... Oh well, it's out of my hands now... It's all localhost so it's no biggie but still...



Last-Modified is not enough:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Caching

Although, it seems to work with EDGE. Let's do it anyway.

from email.utils import parsedate_tz, mktime_tz
timestamp = mktime_tz(parsedate_tz("Thu, 16 Oct 2014 01:16:17 EDT"))

The code I have right now has time difference:
If-Modified-Since: Thu, 14 Mar 2019 17:33:06 GMT

cards.title: Switch to Linux
cards.description: Switch my main computer to Linux. Fix the import ctypes stuff and windll.kernel32.GetLogicalDrives() stuff

cards.title: Screenshots
cards.description:
This here is the description. You can enter more details than just the title above. Click on a card to see this view.

The ugly rectangles above are labels. Simply click on them to toggle them on or off. Use them to categorize your cards. Red means bugs, orange means change requests, yellow means testing, etc.

- [ ] You can also make checklists like so
- [x] You will see a progress bar on the card

cards.title: Prepend broke when I switched to GUID
GUID-like ids
cards.description:
I was using numeric ids inside strings and JS sorts them!

>>> x = { "0": "a", "1": "b", "2": "c" };
Object(3) [ "a", "b", "c" ]

So I switched to GUID-like ids
